result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek David Soderstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek David Soderstrom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek David Soderstrom was found guilty of Sell/Deliver/Possess Firearm Silencer [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.298(2).
  • Derek David Soderstrom was found guilty of Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Derek David Soderstrom was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to Probation today March 16, 2016 by 2:00 p.m.
Court will consider early release from Probation.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

DNA surcharge.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation and follow all recommendations for treatment.

-Follow treatment recommended through AODA.
-Provide Discharge Summary for AODA to Agent.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with R. Soderstrom or the Reeds family.
-Subject to random UA's and PBT's. 
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

-No illegal possession of a firearm.

-Comply with Deferred Judgment of Conviction.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, R. Soderstrom.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

CO: EFV, RPT: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes,  DF ATTY:  Barry Curtis Lundeen,  DF:  Derek David Soderstrom appeared. Includes 14CF97 & 14CM88. ADA Nieskes states they have an agreement, Count 1 of 14CF97 DP, Count 2 dismissed and Count 3 amend to 940.21(1)(a) neg. handling of firearm and Count 4 dismissed and will add Count 5 Disorderly to 14CF97 and 14CM88 dismissed.  Court questions Defendant and he understands. Defendant enters a NC plea to Count 1 14CF97 and NC to amended Count 3 in 14CF97 and NC to Count 5. Information will be submitted to the Court before noon today adding Count 5 DC to 14CF97. Atty Lundeen agrees to oral agreement.  Court will amend bond .

Court accepts Defendant's plea but holds withholds entry on Count 1 in favor of Deferred Judgment of Conviction (2 yr) and finds Defendant Guilty of amended Count 3 and Guilty of Count 5 Disorderly w/out domestice abuse assessment in 14CF97. Court dismisses 14CM88. 

Court orders costs of $243.00 each Count and $200.00 DNA surcharge on 1 Count. Defendant to meet with payment clerk.
Plea hearing on April 24, 2015 at 08:45 am.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Sharon Correll   DF ATTY:  Barry Curtis Lundeen   DF:  Derek David Soderstrom appeared. Case called at 2:20 p.m. Atty Lundeen states no resolution yet. Offer has been extended by the state. Atty Lundeen's addresses his Motion in Limine. Asking court to issue Order to exclude evidence on firearm. 14CM88  asking court to exclude PBT results. ADA Correll's response on number 2 in Motion in Limine states that is relevant testimony in regards to the charge. Atty Lundeen states that there is no law regarding operating a firearm with PBT. Atty Correll gives arguement.  Number 3- Objection on conviction from Dakota Co. Atty Lundeen gives arguement. ADA Correll goes over that charge and conviction. ADA Correll Motion for Consideration addresses the fact of the the firearm sent to the lab for testing. Multiple parts of Motion in Limine #7. ADA Correll states that copy of the procedures was sent to previous attorney on this case. Atty Lundeen responds. States the Order issued by the court regarding the firearm testing, the crime lab did not follow the order. Court will leave it up to Atty Lundeen if defendant needs to appear in person or on the phone for the  1-6-15 courtdate. Address confirmed. hml  Hearing scheduled for January 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Includes 14CM88 and 13CF97

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, R. Soderstrom.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Not to use or possess firearms. 

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
